1.text: “I loathe my own life; I will express my complaint and speak in the bitterness of my soul.

2.text: I will say to God: Do not condemn me! Let me know why You prosecute me.

3.text: Does it please You to oppress me, to reject the work of Your hands and favor the schemes of the wicked?

4.text: Do You have eyes of flesh? Do You see as man sees?

5.text: Are Your days like those of a mortal, or Your years like those of a man,

6.text: that You should seek my iniquity and search out my sin—

7.text: though You know that I am not guilty, and there is no deliverance from Your hand?

8.text: Your hands shaped me and altogether formed me. Would You now turn and destroy me?

9.text: Please remember that You molded me like clay. Would You now return me to dust?

10.text: Did You not pour me out like milk, and curdle me like cheese?

11.text: You clothed me with skin and flesh, and knit me together with bones and sinews.

12.text: You have granted me life and loving devotion, and Your care has preserved my spirit.

13.text: Yet You concealed these things in Your heart, and I know that this was in Your mind:

14.text: If I sinned, You would take note, and would not acquit me of my iniquity.

15.text: If I am guilty, woe to me! And even if I am righteous, I cannot lift my head. I am full of shame and aware of my affliction.

16.text: Should I hold my head high, You would hunt me like a lion, and again display Your power against me.

17.text: You produce new witnesses against me and multiply Your anger toward me. Hardships assault me in wave after wave.

18.text: Why then did You bring me from the womb? Oh, that I had died, and no eye had seen me!

19.text: If only I had never come to be, but had been carried from the womb to the grave.

20.text: Are my days not few? Withdraw from me, that I may have a little comfort,

21.text: before I go—never to return—to a land of darkness and gloom,

22.text: to a land of utter darkness, of deep shadow and disorder, where even the light is like darkness.”
